data.title: About
data.meta_description: Mitchell Kramer is an accomplished actor and historian who has become widely recognized for his portrayal of Benjamin Franklin. With a career spanning several decades, Mitchell has performed as...
data.text:
BENJAMIN FRANKLIN INTERPRETED

​

Actor historian Mitchell Kramer portrays Benjamin Franklin

Based in Historic Old City Philadelphia

​215-287-3506

[email protected]

Mitchell Kramer is an accomplished actor and historian who has become widely recognized for his portrayal of Benjamin Franklin.

With a career spanning several decades, Mitchell has performed as Franklin for numerous organizations throughout the country.

In addition to his acting work, Mitchell owns and operates Mitchell Kramer Tours, Inc., which offers guided tours of Historic Philadelphia. He is also an accomplished writer, having contributed stories about 18th century Philadelphia to various publications and interactive theater pieces.

Mitchell's expertise and approachable demeanor make him a sought-after speaker and performer, and his vast experience has made him a respected figure in the historical community.

He lives in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania with his wife, Christine and their cat, Turtle.

Clients include:

Independence National Historical Park

Valley Forge National Historical Park

The University of Pennsylvania

Temple University

Yeshiva University

Kean University

The Library Company of Philadelphia, founded by Benjamin Franklin

The Free Library of Philadelphia

Philadelphia Society for the Preservation of Landmarks

Historic Christ Church and Burial Ground, founded 1695

Historic Congregation Mikvah Israel, founded 1737

International Swimming Hall of Fame

Colonial Dames of Palm Beach Florida

Independence Hall Chapter, Daughters of the American Revolution

Pennsylvania Convention Center

Museum of the American Revolution

Franklin Institute

Independence Visitor Center

Johnson And Johnson

TD Bank

Pennsylvania Department of Transportation

Thomas Built Buses

Blue Coat Distillery

Fox Sports, MLB and NFL broadcasts

ESPN, College Football broadcast

ABC Good Morning America

CNN News Network

​

and many more. ​

He is on the Board of Directors of Mount Sinai Cemetery, founded in 1856.

He is a member of the Association of Philadelphia Tour Guides

He is a shareholder of the Library Company of Philadelphia

He severs as program leader for the Road Scholar educational programs in Philadelphia.

​​

The story Lachimo, Lanape Storyteller was included in the anthology,

Patriots, Pirates, Heroes & Spies: Stories from Historic Philadelphia,

published by Grosset & Dunlap, Penguin International.

Kramer has a B.A. in playwriting and history from Hampshire College, Amherst, MA

​and attended the Broadway theater’s Circle In The Square Acting Conservatory.
